        public static boolean hasNonCoreferentialSemantics​(SurfaceElement surf)
        Determines whether a textual unit is associated with semantics other than coreference objects (i.e., instances of Expression class).
        Parameters:
        surf - the textual unit
        Returns:
        true if the textual unit is associated with non-coreferential semantics

      • getNonCoreferentialSemantics

        Gets semantic content associated with the textual unit other than coreferential mentions.
        Parameters:
        surf - the textual unit
        Returns:
        a set of non-coreferential semantic objects, or empty set if no such object

      • isRigidDesignator

        public static boolean isRigidDesignator​(ExpressionType type,
                                        SurfaceElement surf,
                                        boolean checkExps)
        Checks whether a noun phrase has a named entity in modifier position.

        This method helps to filter out noun phrases such as "the TRADD protein", where TRADD is annotated as a term, as coreferential mentions. These are also called rigid designators. If the parameter checkExps is set to true, it will ensure that the semantic object in modifier position is not a coreferential mention.

        Parameters:
        type - the coreferential mention type of the noun phrase
        surf - the noun phrase in question
        checkExps - whether to check for coreferential mentions in modifier position
        Returns:
        true if the textual unit has a term in modifier position

      • isModified

        public static boolean isModified​(ExpressionType type,
                                 SurfaceElement su,
                                 boolean checkExps)
        Checks whether a textual unit is modified.

        A textual unit is modified (and therefore not eligible for being a coreferential mention) if it is a rigid designator, or modified by relative clauses or prepositional phrases introduced by of.

        Parameters:
        type - the coreferential mention type of the textual unit in consideration
        su - the textual unit in question
        checkExps - whether to check for coreferential mentions in rigid designator check.
        Returns:
        true if the textual unit has a term in modifier position

      • getCompatibleExpression

        public static SemanticItem getCompatibleExpression​(ExpressionType expType,
                                                   SurfaceElement surf)
        Gets the appropriate mention associated with a textual unit, given the mention type.
        Parameters:
        expType - the coreferential mention type
        surf - the textual unit
        Returns:
        the coreferential mention object with the given type, or null if no such mention exists

      • pleonasticIt

        public static boolean pleonasticIt​(SurfaceElement surf,
                                   java.util.List<SynDependency> deps)
        Checks whether the textual unit is a pleonastic-it (e.g., It is possible that).

        The rules are adapted from Wang, Melton, and Pakhomov (2011).

        • It be Adj [for NP] to VP (It is possible for X to be .....)
        • It be [Adj|Adv| verb]* that (It has been shown that ....)
        • It VB [that]* (It seems that ...)
        • NP [makes|finds|take] it [Adj]* [for NP]* [to VP|Ving] (The patient's angina makes it possible to ...)
        • It [MD*|RB*|VB*|VP*] be NP + Clause (But it has certainly been a pleasure to be involved...)
        Parameters:
        surf - the textual unit in question
        deps - the syntactic dependencies for the sentence of the textual unit
        Returns:
        true if the textual unit is a pleonastic-it

      • complementizerThat

        public static boolean complementizerThat​(SurfaceElement su)
        Determines whether a textual unit with the token that is a complementizer.
        Parameters:
        su - the textual unit
        Returns:
        true if the textual unit contains a complementizer that.

      • incompatibleDirection

        public static boolean incompatibleDirection​(SurfaceElement exp,
                                            SemanticItem sem,
                                            CoreferenceType type)
        Determines whether a coreferential mention and a given semantic object are compatible with respect to the direction of the relation and the coreference type under consideration.

        For example, if the mention precedes the semantic object in text and the coreference type under consideration is anaphora, they have incompatible direction.

        Parameters:
        exp - the coreferential mention
        sem - the semantic object
        type - the coreference type
        Returns:
        true if exp and sem have incompatible direction with respect to type

      • closerWithSameOntology

        public static SemanticItem closerWithSameOntology​(Document doc,
                                                  SurfaceElement su,
                                                  SemanticItem si)
        Finds a semantic object that has the same ontological mapping as another one, but is closer to a given textual unit. This can be useful when a referent is found but proximity to the mention is important, as is in some corpora.
        Parameters:
        doc - the document being analyzed
        su - the textual unit, presumably a coreference mention
        si - a semantic object, presumably indicating a referent
        Returns:
        a semantic object with the same ontological mapping as si, but closer to su, null if no such object exists
